intro: Leptorkis aurita, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Leptorkis aurita is often found in woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
